goal.en: This course aims to advance the understanding of the cognitive operations and neural mechanisms underlying emotional memory. We will cover behavioral, neuropsychological, and neuroimaging studies of the interaction between emotion and memory. Each week we will focus on one specific discussion topic, which is associated with a set of assigned readings. In the class there will be a general introduction for each topic followed by the presentations of the readings assigned to the students.

content.en:
1. Overview of emotion, memory, and their interaction.
2. The Neurobiology of emotion and memory.
3. Methods to investigate emotion, memory, and their interaction.
4. Emotion and implicit memory.
5. Emotion and working memory.
6. Emotion and episodic memory.
7. The development of emotional memory.
8. Individual differences in emotional memory.
9. Depression and Memory.
